actor_awards.notes: He was the first actor to win the 'Triple Crown of Acting' (Oscar, Emmy, and Tony). In 1939 alone, he appeared in five classic films: 'Gone with the Wind', 'Stagecoach', 'Mr. Smith Goes to Washington', 'The Hunchback of Notre Dame', and 'Only Angels Have Wings'.

filmography.title: It's a Wonderful Life
filmography.role_description: George Bailey's absent-minded and kind-hearted uncle whose loss of a bank deposit triggers the film's crisis.
filmography.plot: An angel is sent from Heaven to help a desperately frustrated businessman by showing him what life would have been like if he had never existed.

filmography.title: Gone with the Wind
filmography.role_description: Scarlett's Irish immigrant father, a proud plantation owner who instills in her a deep love for the land of Tara.
filmography.plot: A manipulative woman and a roguish man conduct a turbulent romance during the American Civil War and Reconstruction periods.

filmography.title: Stagecoach
filmography.role_description: An alcoholic doctor who rises to the occasion to deliver a baby and stand up to a killer during a dangerous stagecoach journey.
filmography.plot: A group of people traveling on a stagecoach find their journey complicated by the threat of Geronimo and learn something about each other in the process.

filmography.title: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington
filmography.role_description: A cynical Washington press reporter who is initially skeptical of the naive new senator but eventually supports him.
filmography.plot: A naive man is appointed to fill a vacancy in the U.S. Senate. His plans collide with political corruption, but he doesn't back down.

filmography.title: High Noon
filmography.role_description: The town mayor who leads the meeting that ultimately refuses to help the marshal defend the town.
filmography.plot: A town Marshal, despite the disagreements of his newlywed bride and the townspeople around him, must face a gang of deadly killers alone at high noon.

filmography.title: The Hunchback of Notre Dame
filmography.role_description: The King of the Beggars who leads the Parisian underclass and demands sanctuary for Esmeralda.
filmography.plot: A deformed bell-ringer falls in love with a beautiful gypsy girl and tries to save her from the corrupt officials of Paris.

filmography.title: Only Angels Have Wings
filmography.role_description: A veteran airmail pilot who is grounded due to failing eyesight but makes a heroic final flight.
filmography.plot: At a remote South American trading port, the manager of an air freight company is forced to risk his pilots' lives in order to win a contract.

filmography.title: The Hurricane
filmography.role_description: A compassionate, alcoholic doctor on a South Seas island who tends to the natives during a catastrophic storm.
filmography.plot: A Polynesian sailor is unjustly imprisoned by a colonial governor, while a catastrophic hurricane threatens their island.

filmography.title: Lost Horizon
filmography.role_description: A fugitive embezzler who finds peace and redemption in the hidden utopia of Shangri-La.
filmography.plot: A plane crash delivers a group of people to the secluded land of Shangri-La, but is it the utopia it appears to be?

filmography.title: Make Way for Tomorrow
filmography.role_description: The son of an elderly couple who is forced to separate his parents due to financial hardship.
filmography.plot: An elderly couple are forced to separate when they lose their house and none of their five children will take them both in.

filmography.title: The Long Voyage Home
filmography.role_description: A rough, hard-drinking sailor on a merchant ship carrying explosives across the Atlantic.
filmography.plot: The crew of a merchant ship faces German mines, storms, and personal conflicts as they transport a dangerous cargo.

filmography.title: Pocketful of Miracles
filmography.role_description: A pool-playing judge who helps transform Apple Annie into a society lady. Mitchell's final film role.
filmography.plot: A gangster helps an old apple-seller pose as a wealthy society matron to impress her daughter.

filmography.title: While the City Sleeps
filmography.role_description: The managing editor of a newspaper caught in a power struggle to catch a serial killer.
filmography.plot: Reporters compete to solve a series of murders in order to win a promotion at a major media conglomerate.

filmography.title: The Dark Mirror
filmography.role_description: A police detective investigating a murder involving identical twin sisters.
filmography.plot: A woman is suspected of murder, but she has an identical twin sister, creating an alibi that stymies the police and a psychiatrist.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Writing, Original Motion Picture Story

filmography.title: The Outlaw
filmography.role_description: The famous sheriff who has a complex friendship and rivalry with Doc Holliday and Billy the Kid.
filmography.plot: Billy the Kid and Doc Holliday fight over a horse and a woman while Sheriff Pat Garrett tries to keep the peace.

filmography.title: Wilson
filmography.role_description: The loyal private secretary and advisor to President Woodrow Wilson.
filmography.plot: A biographical look at the life of Woodrow Wilson, from his days as Princeton University president to his time in the White House.

filmography.title: Our Town
filmography.role_description: The town doctor and father of George in this adaptation of Thornton Wilder's play.
filmography.plot: Life, love, and death in a small New Hampshire town in the early 20th century.

filmography.title: The Black Swan
filmography.role_description: A boisterous pirate and loyal mate to Tyrone Power's character.
filmography.plot: A reformed pirate is made governor of Jamaica and enlists the help of his former crew to rid the Caribbean of buccaneers.

filmography.title: Bataan
filmography.role_description: A tough, cynical corporal fighting a hopeless delaying action in the Philippines.
filmography.plot: A small group of American soldiers defend a bridge on the Bataan peninsula against the Japanese army.

filmography.title: The Keys of the Kingdom
filmography.role_description: An atheist doctor and lifelong friend of a Scottish priest serving in China.
filmography.plot: A Scottish priest establishes a mission in China and endures decades of hardship, war, and personal loss.

filmography.title: Tales of Manhattan
filmography.role_description: A husband who discovers his wife's infidelity through a cursed tailcoat.
filmography.plot: A black tailcoat passes through the hands of various owners, affecting their lives in different ways.

filmography.title: Moontide
filmography.role_description: A parasitic 'friend' who manipulates the main character for money.
filmography.plot: A dockworker with a hazy memory rescues a woman from suicide, but his manipulative friend threatens their happiness.

filmography.title: Adventure
filmography.role_description: A sailor who believes he has lost his soul, acting as a spiritual anchor in the story.
filmography.plot: A roughneck sailor marries a librarian on a whim, leading to a clash of lifestyles and philosophies.

filmography.title: Three Wise Fools
filmography.role_description: A manservant to three elderly bachelors who get involved with a young girl and a leprechaun.
filmography.plot: Three grumpy old men are entrusted with the care of a young girl who believes in leprechauns.

filmography.title: By Love Possessed
filmography.role_description: A senior law partner who has been embezzling funds, creating a moral dilemma for the protagonist.
filmography.plot: A lawyer's perfectly ordered life unravels when he discovers his partner's fraud and engages in an affair.
